main event: Sighting of an unidentified flying object in Cleveland, Ohio on June 13, 1954
interesting points: The object was observed by multiple witnesses, including a Mr. and Mrs. and their neighbor.
The object was described as pulsating and changing color from orange to red to blue and back to orange in approximately 30-35 second intervals.
The object was observed to be rotating and flying at an altitude just below the clouds.
Another sighting was recorded on June 23, 1954, with the object described as cigar-shaped and moving at a high speed.
The duration of the sightings ranged from 1 to 12 minutes, indicating possible reliability of the observations.
sighted object: pulsating, rotating, color-changing object; cigar-shaped object
witnesses: multiple private citizens, including Mr. and Mrs. and their neighbor
photographs: no photographs included in the report
